Class Instructions

java.lang.Object
Screen
Instructions
public class Instructions
extends Screen
Screen that handles the creation and presentation of the instructions screen, where the user can read a detailed explanation of the program controls in a separate window whenever they press an instructions Button.
Author:
Takiyah Price
See Also:
Screen

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Instructions()
    Constructor for the Instructions class, which creates the Texts containing the instructions for each component of the program, anchors them to a new Scene and sets a new Stage with it.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void closeScreen()
    Overrides Screen showScreen.
    static void setHighlightedSection​(int screenIdx)
    Bolds the titles of the relevant sections of the instructions depending on where the user is in the application.
    void showScreen()
    Overrides Screen showScreen.

    Methods inherited from class Screen

    getPreviousScreen, goToPreviousScreen, setEditable, setPreviousScreen, setUneditable

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Instructions

      public Instructions()
      Constructor for the Instructions class, which creates the Texts containing the instructions for each component of the program, anchors them to a new Scene and sets a new Stage with it.

  • Method Details

    • showScreen

      public void showScreen()
      Overrides Screen showScreen. Pop up the instructions screen and moves it to the front.
      Overrides:
      showScreen in class Screen

    • closeScreen

      public void closeScreen()
      Overrides Screen showScreen. closes the instruction screen stage.
      Overrides:
      closeScreen in class Screen

    • setHighlightedSection

      public static void setHighlightedSection​(int screenIdx)
      Bolds the titles of the relevant sections of the instructions depending on where the user is in the application.
      Parameters:
      screenIdx - the index of the section to highlight corresponding to the ArrayList of TitledPanes.
